Pre-Game Insights: Padres ace right-hander Michael King is set to take the mound for the Friars, having pitched seven shutout innings, struck out 12, and limited the Atlanta Braves to five hits in the Padres' 4-0 victory in Game 1 of a National League Wild Card Series last Tuesday.
King said he would 'definitely take a little bit of confidence from' his performance against the Braves, 'but definitely needs to be flush because it's a totally different team.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: ESPN's matchup predictor gives the Padres a 64.7% chance of winning, the Dodgers a 35.3% chances.
The Dodgers are 9-7 in Buehler's 16 starts. Buehler is 6-1 with a 1.82 ERA lifetime against the Padres, including the postseason.
This article is about the Padres vs. Dodgers game today — Petco Park officials warn fans about behavior
Others: Los Angeles manager Dave Roberts said it was “bothersome” and “unsettling” that a ball San Diego third baseman Manny Machado threw into the Dodgers dugout seemed intended for him.

The Padres defeated the Dodgers, 10-2, in Game 2, hitting a postseason-record tying six home runs, in a game that included fans directing profanities and obscene gestures to Padres outfielder Fernando Tatis Jr.
